homework_5

Class WeightedColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • homework_5.WeightedColor

  • public class WeightedColor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores data for a weighted color, essentially a color associated with a client-given weight, and has various useful methods such as returning weight, or brightness, setting the above, or returning it as a string.
    Version:
    11/3/14
    Author:
    Alexander Hoppe

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeightedColor

        public WeightedColor(java.awt.Color c,
                     double weight)
        This constructor instantiates a new WeightedColor object and initializes it to the provided values
        Parameters:
        c - The Color of the WeightedColor
        weight - The client-provided weight value of the color
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the weight argument is outside the range [0, 1)

        This method gets the weight of the WeightedColor
        Returns:

      • getBrightness

        public double getBrightness()
        This method calculates and returns the brightness of the WeightedColor
        Returns:
        brightness value as a double

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A toString method, returning a string representation of this WeightedColor
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this object in the form (r, g, b):w where r g and b are red, green and blue, and w is weight.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
        This method sets the WeightedColor's color to the input color
        Parameters:
        c - The color to change the WeightedColor to.

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(double w)
        This method sets the WeightedColor's weight to the argument passed in
        Parameters:
        w - The weight to change the WeightedColor's weight to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the weight argument is outside the range [0, 1)
